original_title: Kunįkága Remembers Red Banks, Kunįkága Remembers the Welcome Song
overview: The video traverses the history and the memory of a place shared by both the Ho-Chunk and the settler. Red Banks, a pre-contact Ho-Chunk village site near present day Green Bay, WI was also the site of Jean Nicolet’s landing, who in 1634 was the first European what is today Wisconsin. Images and text are used to explore this space alongside my grandmother’s recollections. Each serve as representations of personal and shared memory, as well as representations of practices and processes of remembrance.
title: Kunįkága Remembers Red Banks, Kunįkága Remembers the Welcome Song
